basics.name: Zijian Zhu
basics.summary: Masterâ€™s degree in Electrical Engineering, with 3 years of automotive industry experience. Highly self-sufficient, results-driven, and customer-centric electrical engineer. Experienced in analyzing and documenting system requirements for autonomous driving systems, creating and executing electrical test requirements, and collaborating in cross-functional environments.

work.name: TuSimple Inc.
work.summary: Defined power system requirements, conducted power analysis, and collaborated on high-power systems for autonomous driving.
highlights: Defined power system requirements, CAN dbc, and devised functionality test plans and reports.
Performed power budget analysis for level-4 automated driving systems.
Developed multi-kW DC-DC converters with diagnostics capabilities.
Defined requirements for a 64-hard drive array docking system and a sensor cleaning system.
Triaged x86-based Linux server issues and created troubleshooting guides.
Identified and addressed gaps between product and requirements.

work.name: Ecotron LLC.
work.summary: Managed ECU development processes, translated safety documents, and performed diagnostics and testing.
highlights: Extracted 20,000+ email addresses with Python for CRM purposes.
Translated functional safety documents for vehicle control units.
Oversaw ECU product development and maintained clear communication with clients.
Tested and diagnosed vehicle controllers with MATLAB Simulink and lab equipment.
Led a half-million-dollar ECU development project as the primary point of contact.

work.name: Michigan Technological University
work.summary: Supported students and community makers in DIY projects while ensuring safety and training on technical tools.
highlights: Trained makers on power tools, soldering irons, CNC machines, and 3D printers.
Assisted with diverse DIY projects for students and the community.

projects.name: Software-Defined Underwater Acoustic Communication System
projects.summary: Simulated and evaluated underwater communication systems using GNU Radio.
highlights: Simulated a communication system with GNU Radio and a sound card in Ubuntu.
Improved performance with channel estimation and equalization.
Extracted metadata from field experiment logs using Python.

projects.name: Shuttle Display
projects.summary: Led a team to design and prototype an LED display panel for a campus shuttle system.
highlights: Designed system requirements and translated them into PCB design.
Developed and assembled customized LED displays and Arduino drivers.
